summary: Leslie H Wizelman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list her position, annual salary, and gross pay for the specified accounting periods. The consistent appearance of her name across these payroll documents indicates her continued employment with the HSCA during this timeframe.
significance: Leslie H Wizelman's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the HSCA's operations during a crucial period of its investigation.
